bug.author: Varal7
bug.summary: Trainer.test() does not allow to save logs
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When we use trainer.test() on a fresh trainer, the call to self.log_metrics(log_metrics, {}, step) fails to produce logs. <denchmark-h:h3>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
Steps to reproduce the behavior: <denchmark-h:h4>Code sample</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>model = ... test_dl = ... logger = ... trainer = pl.Trainer( logger=logger ) trainer.test(model, test_dataloaders=test_dl) </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
Metrics are logged.

comments.comment: Because of the way aggregate_metrics is implemented, logs are only produced when we are leaving the current step. Because there is only one step in testing, the logs are stored in self._metrics_to_agg = [metrics] but never logged.
Btw, I was able to log my logs by adding self.logger.log_metrics(logs) at the end of test_epoch_end but I believe this should be the default.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Varal7>@Varal7</denchmark-link> would you be able to send a PR with the fix?
results = trainer.test() results is a dict with the results
